page.title: 02BRICKENDON VILLAGE
page.content: In a rural setting,Brickendon is a village with crossroads,a Green and The Farmer's Boy public house at the centre.The church and many older picturesque houses stand along Brickendon Lane and around the Green,also many pre and post-war houses.Despite very limited amenities house prices rise steadily as the area is very popular,best known for the nearby golf course.Many residents commute to London and Hertford via Bayford,the nearest railway station. The bus service(Hertford-Cuffley)runs 3 times daily.Children attend primary school at Bayford but travel further by school buses for secondary education.It is 3 miles to Hertford for the nearest shopping centre,for petrol,doctors surgeries and hospital. Local housewives regret the closing of the one village shop 8 years ago!
